intro: Gaultheria mantorii, commonly known as the Andean wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in moist, cool environments. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pink in color. Its leaves are evergreen, leathery, and have a distinctive aromatic scent. Gaultheria mantorii is also known for containing compounds with potential medicinal properties.
